comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Why? Explain more what is going on here...why dont we have to add the ReasonWrapper?

comments.author: Alberto Galende
comments.comment: We need to add the ReasonElective to the transaction because otherwise the changes made to that reason elective won't be persisted in the DB. We don't need to add the ReasonWrapper because is not a BusinessEntity anymore, so we don't have an object to persist in the DB.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie

comments.author: Tom Gurrie

comments.author: Jose Martinez
comments.comment: A null DateTime is always a low data, isn't it?

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Yep, but only if TA is running, hence setting it to null here would fail in our new "without TA" unit tests! Furthermore, I dont personally dont like setting "null" on anything if there is an alternative. We shouldnt use null as a value in code really IMO.

comments.author: Jose Martinez
comments.comment: I didn't mean in set..(null), but by default is low Date.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: yeah, and this is setting it back to LOW_DATE. The logic here is that if employerNotified is false, we want to reset the notification method adn the date
